capsules_submitted.utterance: I've heard that Harry's belongings, including his trusty flying broom, are still being kept safe at the Hogwarts Museum. capsules_submitted.utterance:
You know, I've always been fascinated by the idea of wizards having their own flying brooms. I mean, can you imagine having that kind of freedom and power? It's like, Harry has this incredible ability to ride on a magical broomstick, soaring through the air with ease.

I think it's really cool how J.K. Rowling created this whole world where magic is real, and wizards have their own unique experiences and challenges. And flying brooms are just one of those things that make the wizarding world feel so immersive and exciting.
Vernon is an adult, and I think that's pretty common for someone in their 30s or 40s. (Sentiment: Neutral)
